did.abstract: Family letters of a Confederate soldier describing a trip from Georgia to Richmond, Va., via Charleston, S.C., 1861, and explaining removal of camp sites from Fredericksburg, Va., because of general poverty and poor soil in the area. Dillard also mentions his experiences while going to the front lines in 1861, and his parole in 1865.
